solution_line_template: If there are {solar_systems_more_per_planet} more solar systems for every planet in the galaxy, there are {solar_systems_more_per_planet}+{base_per_planet} = <<{solar_systems_more_per_planet}+{base_per_planet}={solar_systems_per_planet}>>{solar_systems_per_planet} solar systems for every planet.

Since the number of planets is {num_planets}, there are {num_planets}*{solar_systems_per_planet} = <<{num_planets}*{solar_systems_per_planet}={num_solar_systems}>>{num_solar_systems} solar systems in the galaxy.
Altogether, there are {num_solar_systems}+{num_planets} = <<{num_solar_systems}+{num_planets}={total}>>{total} solar systems and planets in the galaxy.
